comment: I'm having GPU-related troubles.  With a little over a week left to try out some software before a sale ends, and a little under a month before I build a new PC. Perfect timing :ptv-hearts:
But enough about me, what about you? :D

That said, the internet changes really quickly.

The way I see it, if I start now, it'd be like trying to start a gaming channel on YouTube.
Looooooooots of competition.
it gets lewd in this community doesn't it bgrmystr2 lol. and the competition is nuts for gaming channels
But that is rather cool, there are two youtubers who do mostly Dark Souls content who have recently gotten to the point where they can live off it.
And yes, I've asked myself, "Why do I want to do this?  Is it for the money?  The popularity?  Do I just really like doing this and want to make a living off it?"
Drawing would be a bit of a late start compared to video games, but I imagine it'd be more satisfying :3
technically yes metal, but that's not the bad part don't worry.

Oh yeah, and I forgot, YouTube won't stop trying to claim the title of world's stupidest company.  So YouTube is becoming more and more volatile as a platform...
They seem to LOVE caving in to the organizations that would revel in its collapse.
i reallllly hate how youtube has already bascially dug it's own grave and is at this point just trying to see how far they can dig it
What would make me super happy is if the government would grow a pair and finally step in...
i just wish youtube could go back to the way it used to be when they actually gave a damn about the content creators
These giant companies hold a monopoly on some aspect of the internet, and they have free reign to do whatever they want.
And they always use the argument, "Oh, but we're a PLATFORM!  We don't curate content."
there needs to be some kind of limit on what can be done cause one of the biggest jokes on youtube is the crap copyright claim system
To which I respond, THEN STOP ACTING LIKE A DAMN PUBLISHER.
also agreed
I've heard the Jim Sterling (not sure if he's distasteful or not) has played the copyright system like a fiddle.
hmmm not sure how i should feel about that
He's one of those channels that seems like it's ripe for claims, but never gets hit.  And in his words, he's created a "copyright gridlock."
He more or less, if he knows that his video is remotely likely to get struck, he'll throw in so much material from multiple companies, that they'd have to fight over who gets to claim infringement.
well that could definitly be a problem
Well, YouTube seems to value these giant companies over the people who actually made the platform what it is and actively keep it alive.
it just sucks constantly seeing good youtubers on twitter showing how they keep getting screwed on youtube cause they really don't deserve it
The VoxAdpocalypse was a joke.  The government really DOES need to bring the hammer down on youtube.  They were demonitizing nature videos.  They were demonitizing journalists.
They were DELETING historical footage of WWII Germany because "offensive material"
Like... great job YouTube, apparently you WANT World War III.

Scientists ran the calculations:  If humans attained biological immortality, the average lifespan would be over 9,000 years.
The downside?  You'd die horribly <3
yeah i can see that, not pleasant
On the bright side:  Think about it, you could do EVERYTHING you ever wanted.  and not feel rushed for time!
ohhh that does sound nice.  being able to take your time to get something done.
And there ARE scientists who believe we are close to achieving biological immortality.
Not *true* immortality, but something called escape velocity.
and if we could live for a lot longer, think of all the amazing techology that could be build that we'd get to be alive to witness
Essentially, the amount of time X needed to extend life by Y would become inverted.  As it stands it's something like 5 years of development to extend average lifespans by 1.
Even as we approach 1:1, it'll be ridiculous.
Hell, maybe we could invent replicators if we achieve escape velocity :ptv-laugh:
